intro: Apetahia longistigmata, commonly known as the long-stigma apetahia, is a member of the Apocynaceae family. It is a small shrub native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow with prominent stigmas, which are elongated and prominent. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
